intro: Daucus broteri, commonly known as the African carrot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that contains the seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
